medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age 10 with severe pain in the sternum area. Initially, he experienced 1-2 attacks per year for the first four years, progressing to about two hospitalizations per year during high school due to pain attacks. He describes these attacks as requiring 5-10 days of hospitalization and bowel rest. More minor attacks occur 3-4 times a year, which involve manageable abdominal pain at home. Five months ago, he underwent ERCP with sphincterotomy and stent placement, followed by a second ERCP four months later for further stone removal. He has been stable since.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic pancreatitis since age 10, with multiple ERCPs and pancreatic stones found during exams. No significant past medical conditions aside from pancreatitis.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of pancreatitis or cystic fibrosis.
medical_history.social_history: Active lifestyle; he plays on a golf team and coaches basketball. Lives with parents and brother, follows a low-fat diet, and avoids alcohol. He does not smoke and is managing his condition while attending college.
